manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: A special signature edition vocal microphone for the one and only Billy F. Gibbons. Best known as the guitarist and lead vocalist of the legendary American rock band ZZ Top, Billy Gibbons consistently ranks as one of the greatest guitarists of all time. The Rock ‘n Roll Hall of Fame inductee and iconic blues-rock guitarist from Texas has been performing on the road for decades, and is still musically hyper-active with The Kings of Chaos, the BFG’s and – last but definitely not least - ZZ Top! Offering the same stunning sound quality as sE’s highly-regarded V7, the V7 BFG is a dynamic vocal hand-held microphone with a supercardioid polar pattern, delivering a crisp, open sound that perfectly captures your voice in the most natural way you've ever heard on stage. The sophisticated capsule design helps isolate your voice from other instruments, ensuring vast amounts of gain before feedback, and its brand new, patented shockmount efficiently decouples the capsule from mechanical vibration, providing the lowest handling noise in its class.
UNRIVALED SONIC PERFORMANCE CUSTOM CHROME DESIGN WITH ROYAL PURPLE WINDSCREEN CREATED WITH MR. BILLY F GIBBONS
"The V7, in a word? Perfectamundo!" - Billy F. Gibbons (ZZ Top, The BFGs)

ALL-METAL HOUSING & BEVELED SPRING STEEL GRILLE The V7 BFG's road-ready design is all metal - no plastic parts here. The special chromatized all-metal chassis is designed to hold up under on-stage stress for years, and the spring steel mesh grille is dent-proof and corrosion-free for perfect reliability. Also, see that beveled edge around the grille? That prevents your mic from rolling around when you put it down on top of your amp or the stage floor. (It's the little things that count.) The V7 BFG's gold-plated XLR connector also ensures a loss-free and reliable signal connection for years to come. INNOVATIVE, SPECIALIZED ALUMINUM VOICE COIL The DMC7 dynamic element in the V7 BFG has been custom-developed for a crisp, open sound that perfectly captures your voice in the most natural way you've ever heard on stage - and its sophisticated supercardioid capsule design helps isolate your voice from other instruments, ensuring vast amounts of gain before feedback. Proven Neodymium magnets, tight production tolerances & high-end workmanship ensure excellent sensitivity, superior sound quality and superb consistency. PATENTED INTEGRATED SHOCK MOUNT AND INTERNAL WINDSCREEN The V7 BFG's brand new, patented shockmount efficiently decouples the capsule from mechanical vibration, providing exceptionally low handling noise as compared to other mics in its class. This means you can feel free to move around on stage without fear of rumbles, pops, or anything other than your voice coming through. And the internal windscreen efficiently reduces unwanted wind noise and plosive pops.

SPECIFICATIONS Capsule: Dynamic Voice Coil: Aluminum Magnet: Neodymium Directional Pattern: Supercardioid Frequency range: 40 Hz - 19 kHz Impedance: 300 Ohms Sensitivity: 2.0 mV/Pa (-54 dB) Connectivity: 3-pin male XLR Diameter: 54 mm (2.12 in.) x Length: 184 mm (7.24 in.) Weight: 296 g / 10.44 oz

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to fill out a space in my mic locker. I have SM58s and a Beta 58 but needed one more vocal mic so I thought I'd give this a try. To my ears (and those of my bandmates) it falls somewhere in the middle of the 58s - it's clearer and has more gain than an SM58, but not as good overall as a Beta 58. In my situation the backup singer adopted the V7, lead singer kept the Beta and the SMs are now for guests / spares. It appears to be as well constructed as the Shures, although I guess time will ultimately tell that story, and it looks cool also. For the price you really can't beat it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Might be my fav handheld dynamic mic
reviews.reviewText: Every SE mic I’ve tried has been, at the very least, solid if not darn impressive. The V7 MK is no different. The tighter pattern really keeps background noise manageable, but the MK in particular feels like a hidden gem. This one has the capsule of the V7X, an instrument mic with an extended bass response, but the grille is that of the regular V7, which means it handles plosives a little better than the regular V7X. I would describe the mids as punchy and somehow this doesn’t have that typical dynamic grainy sound that others possess. It’s smooth and despite the increased bass, it still has extension in the top end, maintaining clarity. It reminds me a lot of a condenser sound, and yea, if you put them side by side with an actual LDC, you’d know, but only if you were attempting to notice. Otherwise, this is a fantastic offering and I will sing its praises to anything who will listen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Dynamic Microphone
reviews.reviewText: I barely need to EQ my voice in post with this bc the recording itself sounds so good. I'm very glad I bought this over the SM58 which I thought sounded kind of darker or muddy for my voice in comparison. Quality, construction, and sound are all great. I'll update this review with comments on longevity if I ever have any issues with it over time. In all for $100 you can't go wrong with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great and great looking stage mics. Beat the average Shure Beta crowd. Better value.
reviews.reviewText: Great stage mics, part of a very good line of SE mics, but not quite better than our best Senheiser mic or better than the hypercarodid Shure Beta 58A, which is a step more expensive. These are some of the best and strudiest vocal mics going, and they look great mic'ing a guitar cabinet or drum kit. Other mics in the line, like the paired condensers, and the phantom powered ribbon mics are incredible in their own right. We really like S.E. mics. Both in the studio booth, and onstage, they are great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Mic at fair price
reviews.reviewText: Came with holder, wind sock, bag. Love the color. Most important it sounds great. Recommended to me by sound engineer at a nice club in NB,TX and I'm glad I followed his advice. As good or better then the much higher priced mics in my bag including SM58's, Beta 58, and 2 shure condenser I have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Handy and great sound and quality for the price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Using this currently as a mic for gaming, sounds like a condenser and I have yet to use it around in my studio, I did swivel the boom clamp around towards my drumset and the cymbals sounded incredibly detailed and realistic. It doesn't sound harsh, you can clearly hear the details and I spent a half hour just talking into it and loving the sound. Not a fan of my voice but I was having fun talking and singing into it. Nice bass response when you utilize it's proximity effect, and I consider getting another vintage colored one, and might buy a few of the V7x. Also I'm using a shockmount for a 57, and a deadcat for a AT-2035, and it helps with isolation and plosives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: MICROFONO DE EXCELENTE CALIDAD, MUY CLARO, EXCELENTE SENSIBILIDAD.ME ENCANTÓ.
Excelentisimo producto..!! Muy buena gamma en microfonos y su precio razonable, de verdad más que recomendado..!!

sin duda más allá de el diseño que está genial, la calidad de sus materiales y el sonido y fidelidad q tiene este micrófono me dejo con la boca abierta, seguro q pone a temblar a las marcas de toda la vida, valió la pena esta compra. muy satisfecho

I use to song with a sure sm58 and it’s sure a really good polyvalent micro but since I bought this one I find that I don’t need to push that hard to get the good tone, I’m not a professional singer but this micro is awesome and for me give the performance that I was looking for.I totally recommend it.
Som equiparado, talvez melhor, que microfones dinâmicos supercardioides mais caros! Estou amando utilizado para cantar!
